shelter_worker.name: Maria
shelter_worker.description: A compassionate shelter worker who's seen it all but still maintains a positive attitude.

dialogue.first_meeting: Hello there. My name is Maria. I work at the shelter. Let me know if you need anything.
friendly: Good to see you again! How have you been holding up?
Hey there! Always nice to see a familiar face.
neutral: What can I help you with today?

services.name: Reserve Shelter Bed
services.description: Reserve a bed for the night at the shelter.

outreach_worker.name: David
outreach_worker.description: An outreach worker who patrols the streets to help those in need. Carries a backpack of supplies.

dialogue.first_meeting: Hi there, I'm David. I work with the street outreach program. Can I help you with anything today?
friendly: Hey, good to see you again! How's everything going?
Hello friend! What do you need today?
neutral: Hello again. Need any supplies today?
How are you holding up? Need any assistance?
unfriendly: Let me know if you need anything.
What can I help you with?
health: If you're not feeling well, we have a mobile health clinic on Thursdays in Lowertown.
Make sure you're staying hydrated, especially in this weather.

high: Here's a map I've marked with all the resources in the area. This should help you navigate.
I can refer you directly to our housing coordinator. They have a few emergency units available.
medium: The resource center on Bank Street has computers you can use to look for jobs or contact family.
There's a community fridge behind the church on Elgin Street. Anyone can take what they need.
low: Here's a basic resource guide that lists shelters and meal programs.
If you need immediate help, call this number or go to the drop-in center.

services.name: Basic Supplies
services.description: Essential supplies like socks, hygiene items, etc.
services.success_message: David gives you some basic supplies including a hygiene kit.

services.name: First Aid
services.description: Basic first aid for minor injuries or health issues.
services.success_message: David provides first aid, treating your minor injuries.

services.name: Resource Referral
services.description: Information about services tailored to your needs.
services.success_message: David provides personalized information about services that could help your situation.

café_owner.name: Sam
café_owner.description: The owner of a small café who has a soft spot for those in need but also has to run a business.

dialogue.first_meeting: Welcome to my café. I'm Sam. Can't give away free food, but I might have some work if you're interested.
friendly: Hey, good to see you! How are things going?
Welcome back! You're looking better today.
neutral: Hello again. What brings you by today?
unfriendly: Look, I'm trying to run a business here.
Please don't loiter unless you're going to buy something.

high: I could use a reliable hand like you. Come by tomorrow morning and I'll have some paid work for you.
You know, I might be able to offer you some regular shifts if you're interested.
medium: I sometimes need help with deliveries or cleaning. It's not much, but it's honest work.
If you come by at closing time, I might have some tasks you can help with in exchange for a meal.
low: I can't hire someone I don't know. Prove you're reliable and we can talk.
I have to be careful about who I let work here. My customers are particular.

food: At the end of the day, I have to throw out unsold food. Come by around closing time if you need a meal.
There's a community fridge a few blocks from here where local businesses donate extra food.

services.name: Leftover Food
services.description: Unsold food from the day that would otherwise be thrown out.
services.success_message: Sam gives you some unsold pastries and a sandwich from the day's leftovers.

services.name: Temporary Work
services.description: A few hours of work at the café for cash.
services.success_message: You spend a few hours working at the café and earn some cash. The work experience could be valuable.

services.name: Job Reference
services.description: A reference for other job applications.
services.success_message: Sam agrees to be a reference for your job applications, which significantly improves your prospects.

community_organizer.name: Jordan
community_organizer.description: A dedicated community organizer who works on housing initiatives and advocacy for the homeless.

dialogue.first_meeting: Hi, I'm Jordan. I work with housing initiatives and advocacy for unhoused residents. Let me know if you want to get involved.
friendly: Great to see you! How can I support you today?
Hello friend! Are you taking care of yourself?
neutral: Hello there. Need any information today?
Good to see you again. How's everything going?
unfriendly: How can I help you today?

high: I've been advocating for more transitional housing units. I think I might be able to get you on the priority list.
There's a new housing program starting next month. I can put your name forward as someone who's shown real initiative.
medium: Housing is tough right now, but there are a few programs you might qualify for. Let's look at the requirements.
The waiting lists are long, but I know which applications get processed faster. I can show you how to apply.
low: To get housing, you'll need ID and some documentation. Start by getting those basics in order.
Shelter beds are limited, but at least they provide a temporary solution while you work on something more permanent.

advocacy: We're organizing a community forum next week about affordable housing. Your perspective would be valuable.
Sometimes sharing your story can help change public perception and policy. Would you be interested in talking to some community leaders?

services.name: Housing Application Assistance
services.description: Help filling out housing applications correctly.
services.success_message: Jordan helps you complete housing applications, significantly improving your chances.

services.name: Participate in Advocacy
services.description: Join advocacy efforts to earn respect and connections.
services.success_message: You participate in advocacy work with Jordan, making valuable connections and gaining respect in the community.

services.name: Emergency Housing Referral
services.description: Referral to emergency housing program.
services.success_message: Jordan gives you a priority referral to an emergency housing program, significantly improving your housing situation.

experienced_homeless.name: Ray
experienced_homeless.description: An older individual who has been homeless for years and knows all the ins and outs of street survival.

dialogue.first_meeting: Hey there, newbie. Name's Ray. Been on these streets for more years than I care to count. You look like you could use some advice.
friendly: Hey kid, good to see you're still hanging in there!
Well look who it is! Still surviving the streets, eh?
neutral: Oh, it's you again. What's up?
unfriendly: I'm not a charity, you know.

high: Listen, I'm gonna tell you my best spots. Behind the Italian restaurant on Preston, they throw out good food at 10 PM sharp.
There's an abandoned maintenance room in the parking garage on Slater. You can access it from the service door and it's warm in winter.
medium: The library is good during the day. Warm, quiet, and the staff usually won't bother you if you're not causing trouble.
When it rains, the overhang behind the mall is dry and the security only checks there once a night around midnight.
low: You gotta be careful where you sleep. Some areas get checked by police, others have people who might take your stuff.
Always have a backup plan for where to go. Weather changes, people kick you out, you need options.

police: If the cops come around, be polite but don't volunteer information. Know your rights but don't argue.
Different cops treat us differently. Some are decent, some make it their mission to move us along. Learn which is which.
resources: The mission on Murray Street has showers on Tuesdays and Thursdays. Go early though, line gets long.
Community health center doesn't ask for ID or health card. They're good people there.

services.name: Survival Tips
services.description: Practical advice for urban survival.
services.success_message: Ray shares some hard-earned wisdom about surviving on the streets that could prove very valuable.

services.name: Secret Locations
services.description: Information about hidden resources and safe spots.
services.success_message: Ray reveals several hidden spots for sleeping safely and finding resources that few people know about.

services.name: Share Supplies
services.description: Share some of Ray's carefully hoarded supplies.
services.success_message: In a rare show of generosity, Ray shares some valuable supplies with you from a carefully hidden stash.

police_officer.name: Officer Chen
police_officer.description: A police officer who patrols various areas. Generally fair but firm in enforcing regulations.

dialogue.first_meeting: Hello there. I'm Officer Chen. I patrol this area regularly. Just keeping things safe, not looking to cause anyone trouble who's not causing trouble.
friendly: Good to see you. Staying out of trouble, I hope?
neutral: Just doing my rounds. Any issues I should know about?
unfriendly: I need you to move along, please.

high: Look, I understand your situation. As long as you're not blocking access or disturbing anyone, I won't give you trouble.
There's a warming center opening tonight at the community hall. Just FYI if you need somewhere to go.
medium: I have to enforce the bylaws, but I'm not out to make your life harder. Just be discreet and considerate.
Try to avoid sleeping in doorways of businesses. It creates complaints I have to respond to.
low: You can't camp here. I'll have to ask you to move your belongings.
This area has had complaints from businesses. I'm going to need you to move along.

safety: If anyone's threatening you or stealing your things, you can report it. You have the same rights as anyone else.
Be careful around the north end of the market after dark. We've had several incidents there recently.

services.name: Safety Information
services.description: Information about dangerous areas or situations to avoid.
services.success_message: Officer Chen shares some important safety information about areas to avoid and current risks in the city.

services.name: Resource Direction
services.description: Directions to legitimate services and resources.
services.success_message: Officer Chen directs you to some legitimate services and resources that might help your situation.

services.name: File Incident Report
services.description: Report crimes or incidents that affected you.
services.success_message: Officer Chen takes your report seriously and files it properly, giving you a sense that your concerns matter.

social_worker.name: Sophia
social_worker.description: A dedicated social worker who helps people navigate the system to access benefits and services.

dialogue.first_meeting: Hello, I'm Sophia. I work as a social worker with the city. I can help you navigate different services and benefits you might be eligible for.
friendly: It's good to see you again! How has your week been?
Hello! I was hoping I'd run into you. Have you made any progress?
neutral: Hello. Do you need assistance with anything today?
How are things going with your applications?
unfriendly: I'm here to help if you need it.
Let me know if you need assistance with any services.

high: There's a special program I think you would qualify for. Let me make a direct referral for you.
I've been keeping an eye out for opportunities for you. There's a new housing voucher program opening applications next week.
medium: Make sure you're applying for all the benefits you're entitled to. The process is complicated but I can guide you.
The wait lists are long, but getting your name on them now is important. I can help with the paperwork.
low: You'll need some identification documents to access most services. Let's start by figuring out how to get those.
The system can be overwhelming, but taking it one step at a time makes it manageable.

health: Mental health services are available regardless of your housing situation. I can connect you if you'd like.
Don't neglect your health. There are clinics that will see you without insurance or ID.

services.name: Benefits Application Assistance
services.description: Help applying for government benefits and services.
services.success_message: Sophia helps you complete several applications for benefits you might qualify for.

services.name: ID Recovery Assistance
services.description: Help obtaining replacement identification documents.
services.success_message: Sophia walks you through the process of replacing your lost ID, which will be essential for accessing many services.

services.name: Crisis Intervention
services.description: Emergency assistance during personal crises.
services.success_message: Sophia provides crucial support during your moment of crisis, helping you stabilize and focus on next steps.

kind_citizen.name: Eleanor
kind_citizen.description: A retired teacher who volunteers with various community initiatives and often helps those in need.

dialogue.first_meeting: Hello there. I'm Eleanor. I volunteer with several community programs in the area. Is there anything you need today?
friendly: Oh, hello again! It's good to see you. How have you been?
Hello there! I was just thinking about you. Are you keeping well?
neutral: Hello. Nice to see you again.
unfriendly: Hello. Can I help you with something?

high: I'd be happy to introduce you to some of my contacts at the community center. They're always looking for reliable help.
There's a neighborhood meeting next week about local services. Would you like to come as my guest? Your perspective would be valuable.
medium: The community garden always needs volunteers. It's a good way to meet people and they share the harvest.
The library runs a job skills program that might interest you. I could put in a good word with the coordinator.
low: There are several community programs that might help you. The food bank on Third Street doesn't require registration.
If you need a warm place during the day, the community center welcomes everyone. They even have free coffee.

personal: I taught elementary school for thirty years. Now I volunteer to keep busy and help the community.
I believe everyone deserves kindness and respect, regardless of their circumstances.

services.name: Provide a Meal
services.description: Offer a hot, home-cooked meal.
services.success_message: Eleanor brings you a container of homemade soup and fresh bread. It's the best meal you've had in a long time.

services.name: Community Introductions
services.description: Introductions to helpful community members.
services.success_message: Eleanor introduces you to several influential community members who might be able to help with your situation.

services.name: Winter Clothing
services.description: Provide warm clothing for cold weather.
services.success_message: Eleanor gives you a warm jacket, gloves, and a scarf she knitted herself.

street_musician.name: Marcus
street_musician.description: A talented guitarist who performs on the streets and has experienced homelessness himself in the past.

dialogue.first_meeting: Hey, I'm Marcus. I play music here most days. Been where you are before, so I get it. Feel free to hang nearby - people often tip better when they see us helping each other.
friendly: Hey friend! Good to see you. Wanna hear a tune?
What's good? Still surviving out here?
music: Music kept me sane when I was on the streets. Still does, really.
I make enough to rent a room now, but it took years to get there. Keep pushing forward.

high: Street performing can be decent money if you find the right spots and times. I could show you some basics if you're interested.
I know which shelter staff can be trusted and which ones to avoid. Let me give you the inside scoop.
medium: If you're gonna sleep outside, do it near places with security cameras. Safer that way.
The tourist areas are good for panhandling, but the cops move you along faster. Trade-offs, you know?
low: Keep your important stuff close when you sleep. I learned that the hard way.
Don't let your stuff look too organized on the street. Makes you a target for theft.

services.name: Share Performance Earnings
services.description: Share some of the day's music earnings.
services.success_message: Marcus splits some of his earnings with you. 'We gotta look out for each other,' he says.

services.name: Busking Lesson
services.description: Learn basics of street performing for income.
services.success_message: Marcus teaches you some basics about where to perform, how to engage passersby, and the unwritten rules of street performing.

services.name: Share Performance Spot
services.description: Allow you to collect money while he performs.
services.success_message: Marcus lets you collect tips while he performs, introducing you as his 'manager.' People are generous and you collect a decent amount.
